text: I have been working closely
with NFL Player Care Foundation on some
of the data analytics initiatives.

Our overall objective is to
improve the quality

of life and that's what
we are trying to
solve using data analytics.
When I got knowledge about

how they're trying to
manually identify the needs,

I was like, let's start to
build something to

automate this process
of identifying the needs
and later build a system that helps
to identify the complexity of those cases.
So there are different, wide variety of cases,
like disaster lost, due to hurricanes, or like COVID.
So we had overwhelming applicants coming,
theyâ€™ve lost a lot of jobs during that period of time.

So there can be cases like that,
 and that could be some sensitive cases
that Player Care Foundation deals with.
Those are on chronic health injuries,
some sort of behavioral health treatment
and things like that.

So, based on that they
try to assess what is the

appropriate amount of
resources and need that they require
in order to well-serve them.

In Amazon SageMaker we are
trying to build a ML model

that helps to predict a
complexity score, which

eventually will be utilized by
the case manager for effective
allocation of resources and services.

Utilizing these
GenAI models in SageMaker
will help us
identify these needs in real time
and also utilize that to
optimize the case resolution time.
